description.text:
Andreas Schneider reports:

libssh versions 0.5.1 and above have a logical error in the handling of a SSH_MSG_NEWKEYS and SSH_MSG_KEXDH_REPLY package. A detected error did not set the session into the error state correctly and further processed the packet which leads to a null pointer dereference. This is the packet after the initial key exchange and doesnâ€™t require authentication.

This could be used for a Denial of Service (DoS) attack.
